meanings.definition: A sudden frenzied rush of a number of horses, cattle, or other animals.
meanings.sent1: During the stampedes, the horses ran wildly in all directions.
meanings.sent2: The stampedes of cattle caused chaos on the farm.
meanings.sent3: The stampedes of animals made the farmer's job quite challenging.
meanings.sent4: The stampedes of horses resembled a powerful force of nature.
meanings.sent5: The stampedes of cattle left a trail of dust and hoofprints behind.

meanings.definition: A sudden panicked rush of a crowd of people.
meanings.sent1: The stampedes at the concert were scary as people rushed to the exits.
meanings.sent2: In times of danger, stampedes can occur in crowded places.
meanings.sent3: The stampedes at the mall during Black Friday sales were chaotic.
meanings.sent4: The stampedes of shoppers trying to get the best deals were intense.
meanings.sent5: The stampedes of people trying to catch the last train home were frantic.
